-1.title: Hog Wild
-1.plot: Judges Myron Mixon, Tuffy Stone and Big Moe Cason are pulling out all the stops for this one - rolling out whole hogs and a host of other surprises to test the two finalists. Who will take home the biggest bragging rights in BBQ?

1.title: Smokin' in Mesquite
1.plot: As temperatures soar, it's not just the meat that's getting cooked when teams head to the desert for the Smokin' in Mesquite BBQ Championship for a taste of the $40,000 in cash and prizes.

2.title: Murphysboro Barbeque Cook-Off
2.plot: The pressure's on as teams compete in one of the most difficult cook-offs of the year - the Murphysboro Barbecue Cook-off. Lee Ann and Myron face off in the whole hog competition while tempers flare between Johnny and one of the local cooks.

3.title: Decatur Jaycees Riverfest
3.plot: Cooking skills, nerves and patience are tested at the historic Riverfest Barbecue Cookoff in Decatur, AL as the Pitmasters battle for the $3,000 top prize.

4.title: American Royal Invitational Barbecue
4.plot: Stakes are high when the best cook teams in the country are invited to the American Royal Invitational in Kansas City, Missouri. Myron faces his biggest rival on the circuit, restaurateur Chris Lilly. Then, Rookie Paul begs for help from pro Johnny Trigg.

5.title: American Royal Open Barbecue
5.plot: The crowds are out for the American Royal Open in Kansas City, MO where professional and amateur teams come together to represent the full spectrum of the BBQ world. The Pitmasters step it up to compete with nearly 500 teams for over 40K in prizes.

6.title: Diamond State BBQ
6.plot: he competition heats up in the northeast, even as temperatures fall at the Diamond State BBQ Championship in Dover, DE. Harry's former teammate, Gary, competes on his own and Tuffy does Myron a favor, which could end up hurting his own chances.

7.title: The Big Pig Jig
7.plot: Pitmasters are going hog wild at the oldest BBQ event in Georgia - the Big Pig Jig. Myron's on his home turf defending his title as self-proclaimed king of hog while Tuffy faces a double challenge as he attempts his first whole hog on a new pit.

8.title: Johnny Trigg's Shootout
8.plot: It's a true Texas showdown when the Godfather of Ribs, Johnny Trigg, challenges his closest friends and fiercest rivals to compete in an all-rib Shootout. For the first time ever, the cookers watch the judges reactions, both good and shockingly bad.

1.title: Butt Out
1.plot: Four of America's top Pitmasters go head to head to prove their pork butt is the best. But when things get fishy, one team is extinguished from the competition as the rest vie for the $5,000 and invitation to the finale for the $100,000 grand prize.

2.title: A Roasted Development
2.plot: Four of America's top Pitmasters face the hottest challenge yet and someone's going to ROAST! With one Pitmaster headed into an ambulance, the rest compete for $5,000 and an invitation into the finale for the biggest prize in BBQ - $100,000.

3.title: Up in Smoke
3.plot: Four of America's top Pitmasters are challenged to one of the toughest low & slow meats - brisket. While the pits are low and slow, tempers flare as these teams vie for $5,000 and an invitation into the finale for the biggest prize in BBQ - $100,000.

4.title: Not a Moment to Spare
4.plot: Four BBQ Pitmasters face off with a BBQ favorite - spare ribs. But first, they face a prehistoric challenge that could extinct them from the competition and their chance at $5,000 and an invitation to the finale for the $100,000 grand prize.

5.title: Fowl Play
5.plot: Four of America's top Pitmasters face off against the trifecta of fowl ... a Turducken! There's $5000 at stake and an invitation into the finale for the largest prize in BBQ ... $100,000 and the Kingsford Cup.

6.title: Bring Home the Bacon
6.plot: The five BBQ Pitmaster winners from this season come together to face the most difficult of BBQ challenges: the whole hog on old fashioned cinder block pits. Only one can win the Kingsford Cup, the $100,000 prize and be named BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion.

1.title: Try, Try, Tri-Tip Again
1.plot: At the Don't Be Cruel BBQ Duel in Mississippi, three Pitmasters face off in cooking their best Beef Brisket and Tri-Tip. These opposite cuts of beef will test their mastery of low-slow cooking, as well as high-heat grilling. Fire up the pits!

2.title: Baby Light My Fire
2.plot: Memphis, Tennessee is one of America's barbeque capitals, and the site of the Annual Pigs in Flight BBQ Competition where three Pitmasters will compete to cook the best Baby Back Ribs and Pork Butt - a challenge that's almost like going whole hog.

3.title: Trimming the Fat
3.plot: It's a battle of the BBQ Generations as BBQ Legend Johnny Trigg faces off against newer, younger competitors. The meats today are Pork Belly and Whole Turkey - one will head to the finale while the others go home squealing.

4.title: All Hammed Up!
4.plot: In Dothan, Alabama competitiors LeeAnne Whippen, Shane McBride and the Brinson Brothers smoke one another out as they try to tackle the challenge of Beef Ribs and Fresh Bone-in Ham.

5.title: Doctors, Divas and 2 Worthless Nuts
5.plot: Salisbury, MD is the home of Purdue Chicken so Diva Q, 2 Worthless Nuts and Southern Krunk BBQ are competing to turn in both white and dark meat on chicken and a rack of pork at the same time.

6.title: The Grand Porkin' Finale
6.plot: It's a true battle of BBQ's best. The five winning teams from all previous competitions go head to head in the Grand Finale to determine who will go home and will end up with a check for $50,000 dollars and win the title of BBQ Pitmaster!

1.title: Deep in the Heart of BBQ
1.plot: Deep in the heart of the Lone Star state, Pitmasters Buzzie Hughes, Will Fleischman and Ernest Servantes compete to see who's got the best Â'cue in Texas. Don't mess with these three teams as they compete for the title of BBQ Pitmasters Texas Champion.

2.title: Peach State Country Picnic
2.plot: The Peach State is known for having some of the best BBQ in the South. Bear Sloan, Danny Outlaw, and Dionn Lanton compete to see who can cook the best Country-Style Ribs and Pork Picnic. Up for grabs is the title of BBQ Pitmasters Georgia Champion.

3.title: True Blue Memphis Style Que
3.plot: Returning winners David Bouska, Rod Gray, and Lynnae Oxley face off in the BBQ Pitmasters Grand Championship.

4.title: Royal Ribs & Burnt Ends
4.plot: At the American Royal World Series of Barbecue, pride is on the line for Rod Gray of Pellet Envy, Tim Grant of TrueBud BBQ, and Stretch of Grinders BBQ. Three teams battle it out for the title of BBQ Pitmasters Kansas City Champion.

5.title: Carolina's Divine Swine Cook Off
5.plot: North Carolina has one of the oldest BBQ traditions in the country. Zach Goodyear of Sauceman's BBQ, Debbie Holt of Clyde Cooper's Barbecue, and Sam Jones of Skylight Inn BBQ Restaurant compete to see who is BBQ Pitmasters North Carolina Champion.

6.title: Bluegrass, Bourbon & BBQ
6.plot: Kentucky has one of the most delicious BBQ traditions in the South. John Foreman of Old Hickory Bar-B-Que Restaurant, Roy Henry of Henry's Boogalou BBQ, and Mike Ramage of Still Smokin' BBQ compete for the title of BBQ Pitmasters Kentucky Champion.

7.title: Father vs. Son
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: When Pigs Fly
1.plot: At the "Smokin' in the Square Festival" in Pensacola, Fl, David Bouska, Eric Thomas, and "Big Jim" Modesitt show off their best spare ribs and pork butt for a chance to win the coveted title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion.

2.title: Por-ken for Dinner
2.plot: At Mobile, AL's 12th Annual Hog Wild Festival, Sara Horowitz, Chuck Baker, and Mark "Pig Daddy" Little cook whole chicken and whole pork shoulder for a shot at winning the coveted title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion!

3.title: Everything Is Beefier in Texas
3.plot: Glenn Gross, Garry Roark, and Michael Character cook beef ribs and beef shoulder clod at Austin, TX's Rodeo Austin for chance to win the title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion.

4.title: BBQ Border Battle
4.plot: Andy King, Jeff Vanderlinde, and Scott Lane travel the nation to show our judges that you don't need to be from the south to know how to BBQ. They're all competing to win $50K and the title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion.

5.title: Race to the Finish
5.plot: At the Martinsville Speedway in southern Virginia, three couples, Rob and Amy Bagby, Jennifer and Tommy Duncan, and Tommy and Lisa Houston race their way to barbeque supremacy. The winner joins special guest Dale Earnhardt, Jr. in pit row.

6.title: Kicking It in KC
6.plot: Pits flair at the 10th Annual Â'Smoke in the Spring BBQ Contest' in Osage City, Kansas, where Lynnae Oxley, brothers Cody and Colby Archie, and Danny Coogle compete for a chance at $50,000 and the title of BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion.

7.title: A NY State of 'Cue
7.plot: At the 2nd Annual New York City BBQ Cookoff in Staten Island, NY, Jamie Geer, Rich Tuttle, and Stump McDowell are showing New Yorkers what real barbecue is and competing for a shot at the title of BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion.

8.title: Champions Q-Off
8.plot: Previous BBQ Pitmasters champions Mark West, Rod Gray, and Corey Brinson battle it out in an all-star barbecue showdown at the Barnesville BBQ and Blues Festival in Barnesville, GA.

9.title: O-Cue-Homa
9.plot: Pitmasters Robbie Royal, Howie Kleinberg, and Jack Waiboer head to the Bixby BBQ and Blues Festival in Bixby, OK for their chance at becoming the BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion and winning $50,000.

10.title: Virginia Is for BBQ Lovers
10.plot: Returning champions David Bouska, Michael Character, and Mark Â"Pig DaddyÂ" Little kick off the BBQ Pitmasters semi-finals in Fredericksburg, VA.

11.title: My Kind of Q!
11.plot: Returning champions Lynnae Oxley, Jeff Vanderlinde, and Rob Â'Rub' Bagby face off for the second BBQ Pitmasters semi-final round in Westmont, IL.

12.title: Show Me the Q
12.plot: "Stumpv" McDowell, Robby Royal, and Rod Gray return for the last of BBQ Pitmasters semi-final rounds before the Kingsford BBQ Pitmasters Grand Championship.

13.title: BBQ Dreams Come True
13.plot: Returning winners David Bouska, Rod Gray, and Lynnae Oxley face off in the BBQ Pitmasters Grand Championship.

1.title: Sweet Georgia Ham
1.plot: BBQ Pitmasters veterans Robby Royal and Eric Thomas face off against newcomer John Ley in this Georgia style contest to see who will move on to win a shot at becoming BBQ Pitmaster Grand Champion.

2.title: Lone Star Smoke War
2.plot: Texas pitmasters JD Davidsmeyer, Matt Pittman, and Junior Urias battle it out for the title of BBQ Pitmasters Texas Champion and a chance to compete for the $50,000 grand prize.

3.title: Kansas City Que-off
3.plot: Kansas City locals Michael Johnson, Richard Fergola, and Joe Pearce step in the ring of BBQ Pitmasters for the title of BBQ Pitmasters Kansas City Champion and a shot at the $50,000 grand prize.

4.title: Smoking in Memphis
4.plot: Tennessee cookers Ken Wood, Michael McDearman and Chris Chadwick summon that Memphis soul and go toe to toe to see who will win BBQ Pitmasters Memphis Championship and the chance to win the $50,000 grand prize.

5.title: Kings of Carolina
5.plot: North Carolina cookers Jonathan Upchurch, Christopher Prieto and Carl Lewis must fan their flames and get things cooking to get a shot at competing for $50,000 and the title of BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion.

6.title: Made in the USA
6.plot: Among Louisianan Jeff Petkevicius, New Yorker Howard Daley and Alabaman Jeff Coon, which wild card competitor will emerge victorious and keep their barbecue dream alive?

7.title: Ribs, Ribs, and More Ribs
7.plot: Among Georgia Champion Robby Royal of Rescue Smokers, Texas Champion Junior Urias of Up in Smoke and Wild Card Champion John Coon of House of Q, who will emerge victorious to continue on to win the title of BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion?

8.title: Best in Beef
8.plot: Regional Champions Joe Pearce, Ken Wood and Carl Lewis are grilling to stay alive in this thrilling BBQ Pitmasters Semi Final round. They all know that only one will survive and have a chance to be crowned Kingsford BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion.

9.title: Winner Takes All
9.plot: Semi Final Champions Robby Royal of Rescue Smokers and Joe Pearce of Squeal Like A Pig BBQ go head to head in the Finale to decide once and for all who is the Kingsford BBQ Pitmasters Grand Champion and winner of the $50,000 grand prize.

1.title: Season Premiere
1.plot: Three of the toughest Pitmasters from previous seasons are back and in this first round battle, fresh ham and cowboy steak are on the menu. Who will come out on top?

2.title: Smoker Envy
2.plot:

3.title: Episode #7.3
3.plot:

4.title: Ribs Rematch
4.plot: $50,000 and the coveted title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmasters All-Star Grand Champion are on the line. Reigning Grand Champion Robby Royal is looking for another victory over Junior Urias and John Coon.

5.title: In Like a Briskeet, Out Like a Lamb
5.plot: $50,000 and the coveted title of Kingsford BBQ Pitmasters All-Star Grand Champion are on the line. This matchup features the hottest pitmaster on the competition circuit, Tim Grant, looking for his first win on BBQ Pitmasters.

6.title: The Trigg is Up
6.plot: Pork belly and beef ribs are both on the menu, and Corey and Craig think Johnny just might have the advantage. Can the Grand Father of BBQ move one step closer to another Grand Championship?

imdb.plot outline: This program is about America's top teams in competative BBQ. Teams from all over the U.S. try to become the Kingsford BBQ PITMASTERS GRAND CHAMPION. Professional judges like 3 time world BBQ champion Myron Mixon and Tuffy Stone, score the food prepared by the contestants on taste and tenderness. The best team advances to the next round to get one step closer in becoming the BBQ PITMASTERS GRAND CHAMPION and win $50.000 in prize money.
imdb.title: BBQ Pitmasters
plot: This program is about America's top teams in competative BBQ. Teams from all over the U.S. try to become the Kingsford BBQ PITMASTERS GRAND CHAMPION. Professional judges like 3 time world BBQ champion Myron Mixon and Tuffy Stone, score the food prepared by the contestants on taste and tenderness. The best team advances to the next round to get one step closer in becoming the BBQ PITMASTERS GRAND CHAMPION and win $50.000 in prize money.
